definition_en: Any unit of cultural information, such as a practice or idea, that is transmitted verbally or by repeated action from one mind to another in a comparable way to the transmission of genes.
meanings_ja: インターネットのジャンク文化
笑いをとるために使われるアイデアや画像
example: The internet meme went viral. / インターネットのメムが大流行した。

definition_en: (strictly) A person whose net worth is at or greater than one million units of the local currency, but less than two million.
example: Many millionaires invest in real estate. / 多くの富豪が不動産に投資する。

definition_en: The form of existence belonging to a particular object, entity etc.; a mode of being.
example: The company made a modification to their product design. / その会社は製品のデザインを変更しました。

definition_en: Any vehicle used in modified racing.
meanings_ja: 改良された、調整された (in a technical or scientific context)
example: The company modified its product to meet customer demands. / 会社は顧客の要望に応じて製品を変更した。

definition_en: A subatomic particle forming part of the nucleus of an atom and having no charge; it is a combination of an up quark and two down quarks.
example: The neutron is a fundamental particle in atomic physics. / 原子物理学において、ネウトロンは基礎的な粒子である。

definition_en: To attempt to stop the progression of; to resist or antagonize by physical means, or by arguments, etc.; to contend against.
example: The company was opposed to the new policy. / その会社は新しい政策に反対していた。

definition_en: Expecting the best in all possible ways.
example: He's an optimistic person who always looks on the bright side. / 彼は常に明るい側面をみて楽観的な人です。
The conflict in Palestine has been ongoing for decades. / パレスチナでの抗争は数十年間続いている。

meanings_ja: パイロット（航空機操縦者）
ピオリズム（周期的現象）
example: The pio was flying the plane safely. / 航空機を安全に操縦するパイロットはいています。

definition_en: In a manner showing much potential; with the possibility of happening in a given way.
example: The new employee has potentially high skills. / 新入社員は高く能力を持つ。

definition_en: Able to be sensibly presumed
example: I presume she will be at the meeting / 彼女が会議に来ることは似然的に思います。

definition_en: To declare formally, officially or ceremoniously.
example: The doctor pronounced me healthy. / ドクターは私を健康と宣告した。

definition_en: Something which is proposed, or offered for consideration or acceptance
example: The company made a proposal to increase wages. / 会社は給与の増加を提案した。

definition_en: Something which is proposed, or offered for consideration or acceptance
meanings_ja: 提案書 (in formal or business contexts)
example: The company received several proposals from potential investors. / その会社は複数の投資家から提案を受けました。

definition_en: An objective or aim.
meanings_ja: 契約を提案する (in a business or legal context)
example: I propose that we work on the project together. / 私たちは一緒にプロジェクトを進めようとしている。

definition_en: To suggest a plan, course of action, etc.
example: The company proposed a new project to increase productivity. / その会社は生産性を上げるための新プロジェクトを提案した。

definition_en: To make a strong objection.
meanings_ja: 抗議を行う、非協力的な態度をとる
example: The protesters marched through the streets, protesting against the government's policy. / 政府の政策に反対するデモ隊が通りを歩きました。

definition_en: One who, or that which, provides a service, commodity, or the means for subsistence.
meanings_ja: サービスプロバイダー
医療保健機関 (in the context of healthcare)
example: The company is a reliable provider of IT services. / その会社はITサービスを信用できるサービスプロバイダーです。

definition_en: An inclined surface that connects two levels; an incline.
meanings_ja: アクセス道路 (construction or transportation context)
example: The city installed a ramp to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. / 地市は障碍者に対するアクセシビリティーを向上させるため、スロープを設置した。

definition_en: The act or process of regaining or repossession of something lost.
example: After a long illness, she made a full recovery and returned to work. / その長い病気の後、彼女は完全に回復し、仕事に戻りました。

definition_en: A new set of hounds.
meanings_ja: 中継 (スポーツや通信など)
example: The relay team handed off the baton to the next runner. / Batonを次の走者に渡すチームがあった。

definition_en: The sale of goods directly to the consumer, encompassing the storefronts, mail-order, websites, etc., and the corporate mechanisms, branding, advertising, etc. that support them.
example: The retail store is having a sale. / 小売店でセール中です。

definition_en: A moon or other smaller body orbiting a larger one.
example: NASA has launched many satellites into space to study the universe. / NASAは宇宙を研究するために多くの衛星を打ち上げました。

meanings_ja: サポート・ディベロップメント・アソシエーション (Software Development Association)
スタンダード・デザイン・アトミック (Standard Design Atomic)
example: The SDA is a professional organization for software developers. / サポート・ディベロップメント・アソシエーションは、ソフトウェア開発者のプロフェッショナルな組織です。

definition_en: In some bicameral legislative systems, the upper house or chamber.
meanings_ja: 上院議会（アメリカ合衆国など）
example: The senate passed the new law. / 議会は新しい法律を通過した。

definition_en: A device or organ that detects certain external stimuli and responds in a distinctive manner.
meanings_ja: 調べるための装置 (in a broader sense)
example: The robot uses sensors to navigate its environment. / ロボットは周囲を調べるためにセンサーを使用する。

definition_en: One who owns shares of stock in a corporation.
example: The company's shareholders approved the new business plan. / その企業の株主は新しいビジネス計画を承認した。

definition_en: A place where ships are built and repaired.
example: The shipyards in Japan have been building ships for decades. / 日本の船舶建造所は数十年間船を建造してきた。
SpaceX is launching a new mission to Mars. / スペースXは、新しいマーズミッションを打ち上げます。
What is Stamo's latest project? / スタモの最新プロジェクトは何ですか？

definition_en: Interference on a broadcast signal caused by atmospheric disturbances; heard as crackles on radio, or seen as random specks on television.
example: The static on my radio is really annoying. / 私のラジオに静電気が非常に不満。

definition_en: To sign up to have copies of a publication, such as a newspaper or a magazine, delivered for a period of time.
meanings_ja: 質問に回答し続ける (for online forms or surveys)
example: I subscribed to their newsletter. / 私は彼らのニュースレターに登録した。

definition_en: The science and technology of the communication of messages over a distance using electric, electronic or electromagnetic impulses.
example: The company specializes in telecommunication systems. / その会社は通信システムの専門家です。

definition_en: The science and technology of the communication of messages over a distance using electric, electronic or electromagnetic impulses.
example: The company specializes in telecommunications. / その会社は通信技術に特化しています。

definition_en: A graphical representation of a chronological sequence of events (past or future); a chronology.
meanings_ja: (プロジェクトの)スケジュール
example: The company's timeline shows a steady growth. / 会社の時系列は安定した成長を示しています。

definition_en: Agent noun of track; one who, or that which, tracks or pursues, as a man or dog that follows game.
example: The app uses GPS to track the user's location. / GPSを使用してユーザーの位置を追跡します。

definition_en: To continue over time.
example: The app allows you to track your progress. / アプリはあなたの進捗を追跡することを許容しています。

definition_en: To make a short high-pitched sound, like that of certain birds.
meanings_ja: 些細な声や音を出した (in this sense, it's often used in informal contexts)
example: She tweeted about her new job yesterday. / 彼女は昨日、新しい職場についてツイートした。

definition_en: The sound of a bird; any short high-pitched sound or whistle.
example: What's trending on Twitter today? / 今日のTwitterでは何が人気ですか?

definition_en: To remove or clear a block or obstruction from.
meanings_ja: 阻害の取り消し (in a computer network or system)
example: The firewall blocked our connection, so we needed to unblock it. / ファイアウォールが接続を阻害したため、ブロックを解除する必要がありました。

definition_en: To lie in a position directly beneath.
meanings_ja: underlying structure は、基本的な構造を指す
example: The company's financial difficulties were due to an underlying lack of investment. / その企業の財務問題は投資が不足している基本的な理由で起きた。

definition_en: An advisement providing more up-to-date information than currently known.
example: The company will release updates on its new product every month. / その会社は新製品の更新情報を毎月発表します。

definition_en: (epicene) Gender-neutral third-person singular subject pronoun, equivalent to singular they.
example: The new restaurant is trying to ve the attention of customers with its unique menu. / 新しいレストランは一-of-a-kindのメニューで、消費者の注意を引こうとしている。

definition_en: Against; in opposition to.
example: The new policy is versus the old one. / 新しいポリシーは古いものに対決です。

definition_en: Any element of something that depends on sight.
meanings_ja: 角度 (referring to a perspective or viewpoint)
example: The new visuals on our website will attract more customers. / 我々のウェブサイトに新しい画像を載せて、より多くの顧客を引き付けます。

definition_en: To say or write (something) using particular words; to phrase (something).
example: The company's wording of the apology was unacceptable. / その会社は、歓迎できなかった謝罪の文章の構文であった。

definition_en: To communicate with someone using the Zoom videoconferencing software.
meanings_ja: 過去に高速に移動した
example: I zoomed in on the stage to get a closer look. /私はステージを近く見るために映像を拡大しました。

definition_en: To join or unite (e.g. one thing to another, or as several particulars) so as to increase the number, augment the quantity or enlarge the magnitude, or so as to form into one aggregate.
example: I added a new skill to my resume. / 私は自分のCVに新しいスキルを加えました。

definition_en: A figure formed by two rays which start from a common point (a plane angle) or by three planes that intersect (a solid angle).
meanings_ja: 方向、角度 (when referring to geometric angles or perspectives)
example: The artist used different angles to create a sense of depth in her painting. / アーティストは彼女の絵画で深みを感じさせるために異なる角度を使用した。

definition_en: To give public notice, especially for the first time; to make known
example: We will announce the winner on Friday. / 我々は金曜日には優勝者を発表します。

definition_en: An act of announcing, or giving notice.
meanings_ja: 公告 (kokuho) - A formal statement or notice to the public.
届知 (totsukini) - News or information that has been announced.
example: The company made an announcement about its new product launch. / その新製品の発売について会社は発表した。

definition_en: An annual publication; a book, periodical, journal, report, comic book, yearbook, etc., which is published serially once a year, which may or may not be in addition to regular weekly or monthly publication.
meanings_ja: 年度ごとの、年に一度の
example: The company will have an annual meeting in January. / 会社は1月に年に一度の総会を開催する。

definition_en: A person opposed to a concept or principle.
example: The company launched an anti-smoking campaign to prevent lung cancer. / スモーキングを防ぐためのキャンペーンを開始した。

definition_en: To lay or place; to put (one thing to another)
meanings_ja: 申請する / 採用する (in context of job or education)
example: The company is applying for a government grant. / 会社は政府の助成金を申請しています。

definition_en: To be grateful or thankful for.
example: The team's hard work was appreciated by their boss. / チームの努力はボ Boss により評価された。

definition_en: The art and science of designing and managing the construction of buildings and other structures, particularly if they are well proportioned and decorated.
meanings_ja: 社会的組織の構成要素
example: The new building's architecture is impressive. / 新しいビルのはたから建築が印象的です。

definition_en: To authenticate by means of belief; to surmise; to suppose to be true, especially without proof
example: The company assumes the cost of training new employees. / 会社は新しい従業員の訓練費用を負担する。

definition_en: In a fundamental, essential or basic manner
example: The new policy is basically an extension of the old one. / 新しい政策はほとんど古い政策の延長です。

definition_en: (modern British & Australian, short scale) a thousand million (logic: 1,000 × 1,000^2): 1 followed by nine zeros, 109; a milliard
example: The company's revenue reached a billion dollars last year. / その会社の収入は昨年億ドルに達した。

definition_en: To produce an air current.
example: The wind blown away my hat. / 帽子が風に吹き飛ばされた。

definition_en: A dwelling; habitation; building.
example: He was bold enough to ask for a raise. / 彼は昇給を要求することを単独で行った。

definition_en: Fuss, ado.
example: I don't want to bother you about this. / 私はあなたにこの話をしたくない。

definition_en: The amount of money or resources earmarked for a particular institution, activity or time-frame.
example: The company has a strict budget to ensure profitability. / その会社は利益確保のために厳しい費用限度を持つ。

definition_en: Crowded with business or activities; having a great deal going on.
example: He's busier than ever with his new project. / 彼は新しいプロジェクトに忙しくなる。

definition_en: The ability to hold, receive or absorb
meanings_ja: 容量 (for physical capacity, such as storage or volume)
example: The company has the capacity to expand its operations globally. / その会社は世界的に営業を拡大する能力があります。

definition_en: The physical confine of a river or slough, consisting of a bed and banks.
meanings_ja: チャネル（オンラインストアなど）
example: The TV channel broadcasts a variety of programs. / テレビチャンネルは多くの番組を放送しています。

definition_en: The act of one who chases another; a pursuit.
meanings_ja: 探索、捜査 (in a more formal or official sense)
example: I love to chase after butterflies in the park. / パークで蝶を追いかけてлюбう

definition_en: Noticeably happy and optimistic.
example: The cheerful atmosphere made everyone happy. / みんなを喜ばせる明るい空気を作った。

definition_en: Contentment, ease.
meanings_ja: 快適 (physical comfort), 支柱 (emotional support)
example: This hotel room is very comfortable. / このホテルの部屋は非常に快適です。

definition_en: An order to do something.
example: The general issued a command to attack at dawn. / 将軍は朝に攻撃を指令した。

definition_en: An advertisement in a common media format, usually radio or television.
example: The company's commercial success is due to its innovative marketing strategy. / その会社の商業的成功は、革新的マーケティングストラテジーによるものです。

definition_en: The act or fact of communicating anything; transmission.
meanings_ja: 相互コミュニケーション
example: The company's communications team worked to improve customer relations. / 会社のコミュニケーションチームは、顧客との関係を改善するために努力した。

definition_en: A group sharing a common understanding, and often the same language, law, manners, and/or tradition.
example: The community came together to help those affected by the natural disaster. / 自然災害にあたった人々を助けるために、地域社会が力を合わせて活動した。

definition_en: The action of competing.
example: The company is facing intense competition in the market. / その会社は市場で強い対抗に直面しています。

definition_en: An abstract and general idea; an abstraction.
example: The new marketing strategy is based on the concept of targeting specific customer groups. /新しいマーケティング戦略は、特定の顧客グループをターゲットにするアイデアに基づいています。

definition_en: A clash or disagreement, often violent, between two or more opposing groups or individuals.
example: The company is facing a conflict of interest in its investment decision. / その会社は投資判断で執着の差異に直面している。

definition_en: To proceed with (doing an activity); to prolong (an activity).
example: The project continued despite the setbacks. / プロジェクトは障害にもかかわらず続きました。

definition_en: An option allowing a gamer to resume play after game over, when all lives have been lost.
example: The project continues to gain popularity. / プロジェクトは人気を博し続ける。

definition_en: To proceed with (doing an activity); to prolong (an activity).
example: The company is continuing to grow. / 会社は成長を続けている。

definition_en: To make or form a cross.
meanings_ja: 通行中 (to cross something, such as a road)
example: The pedestrian was at the crossing when the traffic light turned red. /pedestrian wa kōjien de tsūkōchū ni ita toshi no ai o nagasu.

definition_en: An argument, or discussion, usually in an ordered or formal setting, often with more than two people, generally ending with a vote or other decision.
meanings_ja: 対話 (as in a formal or structured discussion)
論争 (as in a dispute or argument)
example: The students had a heated debate about the new policy. / 新しい政策について熱烈な弁論をしていた学生たち。

definition_en: (of a physical distance) Extending far away from a point of reference, especially downwards.
example: The ocean is deeper than I thought. / 私が思っていたより海は深い。

definition_en: The action of defending or protecting from attack, danger, or injury.
example: The company invested in defense systems to protect against cyber attacks. / 企業はサイバー攻撃を防ぐために、防衛システムに投資した。

definition_en: Without question and beyond doubt.
example: I will definitely be there tomorrow. / 明日はとって orada いる。

definition_en: To put off until a later time; to defer.
meanings_ja: 中断された (if referring to a process or action being interrupted)
example: My flight was delayed due to bad weather. / 天気の悪化により、私の飛行は遅れた。

definition_en: The process of developing; growth, directed change.
example: The company's development in recent years has been impressive. / その会社は最近の成長が印象的です。

definition_en: A jump or plunge into water.
example: The scuba diver dived into the ocean. / 水中探検家は海に潜入した。

definition_en: Twice the number, amount, size, etc.
example: The company will double its production to meet the high demand. / その会社は高い需要に応じて生産を2倍にする。

definition_en: One of the simplest or essential parts or principles of which anything consists, or upon which the constitution or fundamental powers of anything are based.
example: The company's financial element was a major factor in its success. / その会社の財務要素がその成功における大きな要因となった。

definition_en: The whole of something; the entirety.
example: The entire team worked together to achieve the goal. /全チームが協力して目標を実現した。

definition_en: To demand and enforce the payment or performance of, sometimes in a forcible or imperious way.
example: The scientist made an exact measurement of the sample. / 科学者はサンプルの正確な測定を行った。

definition_en: The greatest or utmost point, degree or condition.
example: The extreme weather conditions were unbearable. / とんでもない天候は耐えられなかった。

definition_en: A doer, maker; a person who does things for another person or organization.
example: The company will consider other factors in making a decision. / その会社は決断する際に他の関係要素を考慮します。

definition_en: An attendant spirit, often in animal or demon form.
example: I've seen this movie before, so it's quite familiar. / これらの映画を見たことがあるので、非常にした知らない。

definition_en: To calculate, to solve a mathematical problem.
meanings_ja: 考え尽くされた、予測された
example: I've figured out how to fix this problem. / これらの問題を解決する方法を計算した。

definition_en: A business partnership; the name under which it trades.
example: The company is a firm that specializes in designing innovative products. / その会社は新しい製品のデザインに特化した企業である。

definition_en: The degree to which something fits.
meanings_ja: 発作（のようになる） - this refers to a fit of rage, anger, or sudden strong emotion
example: The new employee's skills fits perfectly with our company's needs. / その新入社員は私たちのニーズにぴったり合う。

definition_en: To pierce; now generally replaced by transfix.
Substance consumed to provide energy through combustion, or through chemical or nuclear reaction.
example: The plane needs a lot of fuel to reach its destination. / 航空機は目的地に到達するためには大量のユースタルが必要です。

definition_en: In a full manner; without lack or defect.
meanings_ja: เต็มっとして、完全に
example: I will fully understand your instructions. / 私はあなたの指示を完全に理解します。

definition_en: (ditransitive) to give (permission or wish)
meanings_ja: もたらされた, 承認された
example: The company granted me a week's vacation. / コンパニーは私に休暇を与えました。

definition_en: An area or a spot in a drawing, painting, or photograph that is strongly illuminated.
meanings_ja: 最良の部分を強調する
example: The speaker highlighted the importance of teamwork. / スピーカーはチームワークの重要性を強調した。

definition_en: Payment for the temporary use of something.
example: We hired a lawyer to help us with our case. / 我々は、我々の裁判を助けるために弁護士を雇った。

definition_en: To grasp or grip.
example: I'm holding a pen. / 私はペンを握ります。

definition_en: A short jump.
example: I like to hop across the park at night. / 私は夜に公園を軽く跳ぶの好きです。

definition_en: In a hopeful manner.
example: I'll do my best, hopefully it will work. / 私は最大限に尽力し、望むように成功することを願う。

definition_en: To want something to happen, with a sense of expectation that it might.
meanings_ja: 希望する (to have a strong desire or wish)
example: I'm hoping to win the contest. / 私はそのコンクールを勝つことを望む。

definition_en: One which receives or entertains a guest, socially, commercially, or officially.
meanings_ja: 会員、主催者 (in a corporate or organizational context)
example: The hotel will host a wedding reception tonight. / 今夜ホテルはウェディング・レセプションを挙行します。

definition_en: To bring into a group, class, set, or total as a (new) part or member.
meanings_ja: 連動する (in a broader sense)
example: The report included all relevant data. /

definition_en: To bring into a group, class, set, or total as a (new) part or member.
meanings_ja: また、またありえる (rarely used)
example: The new policy includes all employees, including interns. / 新しいポリシーにはすべての従業員、インターンも含まれています。

definition_en: The tendency to work persistently. Diligence.
meanings_ja: 分野 (in a broader sense, referring to a specific field or sector)
example: The textile industry is growing rapidly in Japan. / 日本の繊維産業が急速に成長している。

meanings_ja: ユダヤ国家（イスラエル国）
example: The Israeli government has been working to improve relations with neighboring countries. / イスラエル政府は、隣国との関係を改善するために努力しています。

definition_en: The action or an instance of flowing or coming out, an outflow, particularly:
meanings_ja: 論争の問題点 (point of contention)
example: The company is facing an issue with customer satisfaction. / 会社は顧客満足度に関する問題に直面しています。

definition_en: A laboratory.
example: I'm working in a lab to develop a new vaccine. / 私は新しいワクチンの開発に研究室で働いています。

definition_en: To descend to a surface, especially from the air.
example: The pilot successfully executed a landing on the runway. / パイロットが滑走路に安全に降着した。

definition_en: The movement of a vessel from land into the water; especially, the sliding on ways from the stocks on which it is built. (Compare: to splash a ship.)
example: We're going to launch a new product next month. / 新製品を来月に発売します。

definition_en: To throw (a projectile such as a lance, dart or ball); to hurl; to propel with force.
meanings_ja: 発売された (in the context of product or service launch)
example: The company launched a new marketing campaign yesterday. / 会社は昨日、新しいマーケティングキャンペーンをスタートした。

definition_en: A single thickness of some material covering a surface.
meanings_ja: 層状 (physical layer), レイヤー (information technology)
example: The cake has multiple layers. / ケーキには複数の層があります。

definition_en: A legal document giving official permission to do something; a permit.
meanings_ja: 免許 (for driving, operating a business, etc.)
example: The company needs a license to operate in this country. / この会社はこの国での営業に免許が必要です。

definition_en: Lines
meanings_ja: 乾燥した (in a figurative sense)
example: The ll of her garden was impressive. / 彼女の庭園は小さなものながらも、印象的だった。

definition_en: Something used for fastening, which can only be opened with a key or combination.
meanings_ja: 封止する (to prevent access or to secure)
example: The hotel room had a digital lock on the door. / ホテルの部屋には、ドアにデジタル鍵がありました。

definition_en: A visual symbol or emblem that acts as a trademark or a means of identification of a company or organization.
example: The company's logo is a stylized letter "A". / その会社のマークは、字母「Ａ」である。

definition_en: (plural media or mediums) The chemistry of the surrounding environment, e.g. solid, liquid, gas, vacuum, or a specific substance such as a solvent.
example: The company uses a medium to advertise its new product. / その会社は新製品を宣伝するためにメディアを使う。

definition_en: Denoting the middle part.
example: The concert is at mid-night. / ナイト12時にコンサートがある。

definition_en: Armed forces.
example: The military is preparing for a possible war. / 軍隊は戦争の可能性に備えています。

definition_en: A set of tasks that fulfills a purpose or duty; an assignment set by an employer, or by oneself.
meanings_ja: 神話的使命 (神聖な或は大きな目的)
example: NASA's mission is to explore space. / NASAの専門任務は宇宙を探検することです。

definition_en: Physical motion between points in space.
meanings_ja: 運動（社会運動や芸術的表現）
example: The civil rights movement had a profound impact on society. / 社会運動は、ocietyに深い影響を与えた。

meanings_ja: 航空宇宙 Agency (NASAの略称を含む)
example: NASA is planning a new mission to Mars. / 宇宙航空局は、新しい火星探査ミッションを計画しています。

definition_en: Recently made, or created.
example: The newer car has more advanced features. / 新車はより進歩した機能を持つ。

definition_en: The act of observing, and the fact of being observed (see observance)
meanings_ja: 監視、観測 (other meanings include scientific observation, surveillance, etc.)
example: The teacher made an interesting observation about the students' behavior. / 教師は生徒たちの行為について興味深い観察をした。

definition_en: In an obvious or clearly apparent manner.
meanings_ja: 易に分かる, 自然に
example: She passed the exam obviously. / 彼女は明らかに試験を通過した。

definition_en: (diminutive) An odd number.
example: The odd numbers in this list are 1, 3, and 5. / このリストの奇妙な数字は1, 3, 5です。

definition_en: An object or other creation (e.g. narrative work) from which all later copies and variations are derived
example: The artist's original work was praised by critics. / 芸術家の元本作品は評論家から賞賛を受けた。

definition_en: As it was in the beginning.
example: I was originally from Tokyo, but now I live in New York. / 私は元から東京出身ですが、現在ニューヨークに住む。

definition_en: Other than supposed; different.
meanings_ja: そういうことではない
example: If it rains, I'll stay at home otherwise I'll go to the park. / 雨が降るなら家にいるそうだから、公園に行く場合はない。

definition_en: A garment worn over other clothing to protect it; a coverall or boiler suit. A garment, for manual labor or for casual wear, often made of a single piece of fabric, with long legs and a bib upper, supported from the shoulders with straps, and having several large pockets and loops for carrying tools.
meanings_ja: 全体的に (used to describe a situation or condition)
大まかに (used to describe something that is general or approximate)
example: The company's overall performance was impressive. / その会社の総合的パフォーマンスは印象的だった。

definition_en: (focus) Especially, extremely.
example: I'm particularly fond of Japanese cuisine. / 私は日本料理を特に愛しています。

definition_en: In part, or to some degree, but not completely.
meanings_ja: 一部には、また一部には
example: The new policy was partly responsible for the company's success. / 新しい政策は会社の成功の一部に影響していた。

definition_en: An artifact or document rendering something allowed or legal.
example: The government will permit the construction project. / 政府は建設プロジェクトを許可します。

definition_en: In a personal manner.
meanings_ja: その人の個人的な関係
example: I'm going to the party personally. / 私は自分でパーティーに行く

definition_en: To design (a building, machine, etc.).
example: The company is planning a new product launch. / 会社は新製品発売を検討しています。

definition_en: A raised stage from which speeches are made and on which musical and other performances are made.
example: The tech startup built its platform on open-source software. / テクノロジー スタートアップはオープンソース ソフトウェアにプラットフォームを構築した。

definition_en: To engage in political activity; politick.
example: The new president is expected to make some significant changes in politics. / 新大統領は、政治の激変を期待されています。

definition_en: (with present-tense constructions) First; beforehand, in advance.
example: I had previously studied French. / フランス語を以前勉強していた。

definition_en: The act of producing, making or creating something.
example: The company increased its production to meet growing demand. / その会社は需要が増加したため、生産を増強しました。

definition_en: Movement or advancement through a series of events, or points in time; development through time.
meanings_ja: 進歩 (in a specific field or area)
example: The company has made significant progress in developing new products. / 会社は新製品の開発で大きな進歩を遂げました。

definition_en: One who protests, either singly or in a public display of group feeling.
example: The protesters marched through the city streets to demand change. / 市中を示談して変革を求める反対派集団

definition_en: A formal objection, especially one by a group.
meanings_ja: 抗議行動 (other possible meanings include "反対声明" or "抗議活動", but these two are more common)
example: The government faced protests over the new tax law. / 政府、新税法に対する反対運動に直面した。

definition_en: Anything that is difficult to understand or make sense of.
example: This jigsaw puzzle is a lot of fun! / このジグソーパズルは大楽しみです！

definition_en: A quotation; a statement attributed to a person.
example: The author's quote resonated with me. / 私には著者の引用が響いた。

definition_en: (physical) To cause to rise; to lift or elevate.
example: The company is raising funds to support local charities. / その会社は地元の福祉団体を支援するために資金を募集しています。

definition_en: To assign or be assigned a particular rank or level.
example: The movie got a high rating from critics. / 評論家たちは映画に高評価を与えた。

definition_en: With constant frequency or pattern.
example: I exercise regularly. / 私は通常運動しています。

definition_en: The manner in which two things may be associated.
meanings_ja: 関係状態 (in a broader sense)
example: The company's relations with its clients have improved. / その会社は、クライアントとの関係を改善しました。

definition_en: To let go (of); to cease to hold or contain.
example: The new movie was released last Friday. / 新しい映画は昨日公開された。

definition_en: A delegate.
meanings_ja: 代理人 (in a business or organizational sense)
example: The company's representatives met with the investors to discuss the new project. / コーポレーションの代理人が投資家たちと新プロジェクトの話をしていた。

definition_en: A necessity or prerequisite; something required or obligatory. Its adpositions are generally of in relation to who or what has given it, on in relation to whom or what it is given to, and for in relation to what is required.
meanings_ja: 申し込み要件, 適切な技能
example: The company has a requirement for all employees to have a high school diploma. / 社内には、高校卒業資格を持つ全員が必要です。

definition_en: A rocket engine.
example: NASA launched a rocket to explore Mars. / NASAは火星を探検するためにロケットを打ち上げた。

definition_en: A rocket engine.
meanings_ja: 太空探査機 (in a scientific or technological context)
example: The company is developing new rockets to launch satellites into space. / その会社は人工衛星を太空に打ち上げるための新しい弾道発射体を開発しています。

definition_en: Unstable; easily rocked.
example: The hikers faced a rocky terrain. / 登山者たちは険しい地形に遭遇した。

meanings_ja: (gurassuru) - a type of squash or pumpkin
example: John is reading a book about Russell's philosophy. / (Johnはルースルの哲学についての本を読んでいます。)

definition_en: Cause, interest or account
example: I love drinking sake with friends. / 私は友達と日本酒を飲むのが大好きです。

definition_en: A part or snippet of something taken or presented for inspection, or shown as evidence of the quality of the whole; a specimen.
meanings_ja: サンプリング (as in statistical sampling)

definition_en: A ladder; a series of steps; a means of ascending.
example: The company will scale down its operations. / その会社は営業を縮小します。

definition_en: To choose one or more elements of a set, especially a set of options.
meanings_ja: 選挙された (in a political context)
example: The company selected him as the new CEO. / その会社は彼を新しいCEOに選んだ。

definition_en: A program that provides services to other programs or devices, either in the same computer or over a computer network.
example: The server is responsible for hosting our website. / サーバーは、私たちのウェブサイトをホストしています。

definition_en: The act of shaking or being shaken; tremulous or back-and-forth motion.
meanings_ja: 露れた (in a figurative sense, e.g. "her confidence was shaken")
example: The coffee shop serves shakes with various flavors. / コーヒーショップでは、色々な味のシェークスを提供しています。

definition_en: To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
example: We decided to share a car to get to the concert. / мы 決めた車を分かち合うことでコンサートに至ることにした。

definition_en: The result of launching a projectile or bullet.
example: The photographer took great shots of the sunset. / 太陽下りの写真を撮影した。

definition_en: To display, to have somebody see (something).
example: The company is showing its new products at the exhibition. / 会社は新製品を展示会で紹介しています。

definition_en: A sequence of states representing an encoded message in a communication channel.
meanings_ja: 手応え（teno） (in the context of computer science or engineering)
example: The signal light turned green, so I drove through. / グリーンライトが光ったので、通過した。

definition_en: That which has significance; a sign; a token; a symbol.
example: The discovery was significant because it changed our understanding of the universe. / 宇宙の理解が変わるため、その発見は大きな影響を与えた。

definition_en: The part of a garment that covers the arm.
example: I rolled up my sleeves to help with the cleaning. / 私は掃除に協力するために袖を巻きました。

definition_en: A homogeneous mixture, which may be liquid, gas or solid, formed by dissolving one or more substances.
example: The company is searching for a solution to their financial problems. / その会社は財務問題の解決策を探しています。

definition_en: In a specific manner, applying to or naming a particular thing or things, expressly, explicitly
example: I'm interested in this project specifically because it aligns with my skills. / 私はこのプロジェクトについて興味があるのではなく、スキルに則したためです。

definition_en: A principle or example or measure used for comparison.
example: The company sets a high standard for customer service. / その会社は顧客サービスに対する高い標準を設定しています。

definition_en: A store or supply.
example: The company has a strong stock of raw materials. / その会社には原材料が強い市況がある。

definition_en: A cohesive whole built up of distinct parts.
example: The company has a strong organizational structure. / その会社には強い組織を持ちます。

definition_en: To take for granted; to conclude, with less than absolute supporting data; to believe.
example: I suppose it will rain tomorrow. / 明日雨が降るだろう。

definition_en: A person who is suspected of something, in particular of committing a crime.
example: The police suspect that he is involved in the crime. / 警察は彼が犯罪に関与していると疑う。

definition_en: A collection of organized things; a whole composed of relationships among its members.
meanings_ja: 計算システム, 社会システム (depending on the context)
example: The company has implemented a new accounting system to streamline operations. / 会社は新しい会計系譜を導入して業務の効率化を目指す。

definition_en: A closed container for liquids or gases.
example: The army deployed tanks to secure the area. / 軍隊は地区を確保するために武装車両を展開した。

definition_en: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
example: The company set its target to increase sales by 20%. / 社会が、20%の売り上げ増加を目指す。

definition_en: A butt or mark to shoot at, as for practice, or to test the accuracy of a firearm, or the force of a projectile.
example: The company set targets to increase sales by 20% within a year. / 年に20%の売上増加を目指した企業は、目標を設定しました。

definition_en: That which limits the extent of anything; limit, extremity, bound, boundary.
example: The company will review the terms of the contract. / その会社は契約の条件を検討する。

definition_en: The periodic change of the sea level, particularly when caused by the gravitational influence of the sun and the moon.
A unit of weight (mass) equal to 2240 pounds (a long ton) or 2000 pounds (a short ton) or 1000 kilograms (a metric ton).
example: This car weighs about 2 tons. / この車は約2トンの重量をしています。

definition_en: An amount obtained by the addition of smaller amounts.
example: The total cost of the trip was $500. / 行き先の総額は500ドルです。

definition_en: In the direction of.
example: I'm moving towards my dream. / 私は私の夢に向かって動いています。

definition_en: In a traditional manner.
meanings_ja: 伝統的に、慣習的に (if there are multiple meanings)
example: The company has traditionally prioritized customer service. / 会社は従来、顧客サービスを重視してきた。

definition_en: An expression used to show contentment for something
example: "What did you say?" "Um, I think it was something about meeting later." / 「何言ったの？」「あ、思うに会う時間何かだったみたい」

definition_en: Happening through bad luck, or because of some unfortunate event.
example: I accidentally broke my phone. Unfortunately, it was a new one. / 私は偶然に電話を壊してしまった。非常に残念に、最新のものであった。

definition_en: An advisement providing more up-to-date information than currently known.
example: I need to update my software to fix the bug. / ソフトウェアをバグの修正に最新化する必要があります。

definition_en: To bring (a thing) up to date.
meanings_ja: 最新の状態に調整された
example: The software was updated to fix bugs. / ソフトウェアはバグを修正したため最新の状態になった。

definition_en: Towards a higher place; towards what is above.
meanings_ja: 成長、増加 (referring to an increase or growth)
example: I'm going upwards to the top of the mountain. / 私は山頂に上ります。

definition_en: A conveyance; a device for carrying or transporting substances, objects or individuals.
example: The vehicle drove down the highway. / 高速道路を車両で走った。

definition_en: A conveyance; a device for carrying or transporting substances, objects or individuals.
meanings_ja: 船舶、飛行機など交通機関
example: The company is a leading manufacturer of vehicles. / その会社は自動車など交通機関の製造に積極的に取り組んでいる。

definition_en: A three-dimensional measure of space that comprises a length, a width and a height. It is measured in units of cubic centimeters in metric, cubic inches or cubic feet in English measurement.
example: The volume of the music was too loud. / 音量がとても大きかった。

definition_en: To wish for or desire (something); to feel a need or desire for; to crave or demand.
example: I've been wanting a new car. / 私は新しい自動車が欲しい。

definition_en: To be affected with surprise or admiration; to be struck with astonishment; to be amazed; to marvel; often followed by at.
example: I was wondering what the best way to get there would be. / 私はそこに行くベストの方法を考えていた。
I'm planning to visit New Zealand soon. / 私は、ニュージーランドに旅行計画しています。

meanings_ja: 古代ギリシアの数学者
物理学や機械工学に関する名誉の名称 (Archimedean screw, Archimedean spiral)
example: The ancient Greek mathematician Archimedes was a pioneer in the field of physics. / アルキメデスの古典的貢献は物理学の分野で顕著であった。

definition_en: A large log to burn at the back of a fire.
meanings_ja: 備蓄量、積み上げの状態
example: We're trying to clear our backlog of unfinished projects. / 自分たちの未完了プロジェクトをクリアング中です。

meanings_ja: (bārinjā) - a British politician and former MP for Beaconsfield
(Borūn bārinjā) - a crater on Mars named after a geologist who studied it
example: The Ballinger of UK is known for his environmental activism. / UKのBallingerは環境保護活動家として知られています。

definition_en: Resembling or likened to a bear, typically in being rough, surly, or clumsy.
meanings_ja: 伸びない、衰退する (in finance, referring to a market trend)
example: The stock market has been bearish lately. / 最近の株式市場は憂い深まりました。

definition_en: Either literally or figuratively to stop or hesitate as if suddenly seeing a bogle.
meanings_ja: びっくりするほど奇妙な
example: The math problem was boggling, even for a genius. / その数学の問題は、甚至に天才にも驚くばかりだった。

definition_en: A sheet of copper or steel used in the construction of a boiler.
meanings_ja: 一般的な文書のフレームワーク
重複的な記述や慣習的な表現
example: The company's boilerplate statement claimed they were committed to diversity and inclusion. / その企業は多様性と包括性に熱心であると一般的な文書で述べていた。

definition_en: The narrow portion that forms the pouring spout of a bottle; the neck of a bottle.
example: The new software has become a bottleneck in our workflow. / 新しいソフトウェアが我々のワークフローで交通の障害になった。

definition_en: Having a muscular physique
meanings_ja: 投機的、自信ある (in finance and business contexts)
example: The company's bullish outlook led to a surge in stock prices. / その会社の独特な勢いは株価に拍車を掛けた。

definition_en: Associated with or participating in an activity, especially one of a questionable nature.
example: The CEO was complicit in the company's illegal activities. /CEOは会社の不正な活動に共謀していた。

definition_en: To smoothen or even a surface (especially a connection or junction on a surface).
meanings_ja: 外部装甲 (in aeronautics or automotive context)
example: The fairing on the spacecraft helped reduce drag. / 宇宙船の舗道はドラッグを減らした。

definition_en: A structure on various parts of a vehicle, for example an aircraft, automobile, or motorcycle, that produces a smooth exterior and reduces drag
meanings_ja: スポーツカーのカウル (for sports cars)
example: The new fighter jet's fairings were designed to reduce drag. / 新型戦闘機の翼部分はドラッグを低減するように設計された。

definition_en: To furnish or deck out with flags.
meanings_ja: 需要に応じる (in computing, e.g. flagging errors)
example: The new employee was flagging due to the intense workload. / 新入社員は過密のために弱気を示した。
The aquarium had many species of gobiids from different parts of the world. / アクアリウムには世界の異なる部分から多くのゴバニア魚種類があった。

definition_en: The state or quality of being intricate or entangled.
example: The company's intricacies made it difficult to understand their financial reports. / その企業の複雑な部分は財務報告を理解することが困難でした。

definition_en: Of a body in motion: the tendency of a body to maintain its inertial motion; the product of its mass and velocity.
example: The company gained momentum in its new product line. / その新製品ラインは勢いに乗った。

definition_en: (chiefly Texas) A copse or small grove of trees, especially live oak or elm.
example: The new employee had a few motts on his record, but he was given a second chance. / 新入社員には少しある黒斑が残っていたが、再チャンスを得た。
I need a mottbox to store my books. /  私は書籍を保存するためのmottboxが必要です。

definition_en: An object that orbits another, especially a spacecraft that orbits a planet etc. without landing on it.
example: NASA's orbiter was designed to explore Mars. / NASAの周回飛行機は、マーズを探検するために設計された。

definition_en: A person or thing situated away from the main body or outside its proper place.
example: The company's financial data showed that one of their suppliers was an outlier in terms of pricing. / その一社の価格が、他の取引先と比べて異常に高かった。

definition_en: That part of a cargo that produces revenue.
meanings_ja: 寄せ物、積み込み物 (in computing and transportation)
example: The satellite's payloads were designed to collect climate data. / サテライトの実際の内容は気候データを収集するように設計された。

definition_en: A large flat-bottomed towed or self-propelled boat used mainly for river and canal transport of heavy goods or bulk cargo.
example: The company uses barges to transport goods along the river. /会社は河川で貨物を舟艇に積んで輸送しています。

definition_en: A stream or small river.
meanings_ja: 招集する (in a figurative sense)
example: The coach beckoned his player to come off the field. / コーチは選手にフィールドから降りるように手指を出した。

definition_en: Lack of concord, agreement or harmony.
example: The band's discordant sound was a shock to their fans. / バンドの音響的な不調和はファンの驚きだった。

definition_en: A public official in certain countries having control of public revenue.
meanings_ja: 会計年度の（税金や財務に関する）
example: The company's fiscal year runs from April to March. / その会社は4月から3月までの会計年度を持つ。

definition_en: An inverted state: a state in which something has been turned (properly) upside down or inside out or backwards.
example: The inverse of 3 is 1/3. / 3の逆は1/3です。

definition_en: To belong to or be a part of; be an adjunct, attribute, or accessory of
meanings_ja: 適用される (specifically in a scientific or technical sense)
example: The new policy will pertain to all employees. /新しいポリシーは全員に適用される。

definition_en: To extend beyond a surface.
meanings_ja: プロジェクション（映画などの映像）
example: The new building's design features a projecting roof. / 新しい建物のデザインは、プロジェクティング・ルーフを特徴としています。

definition_en: The reestablishment of friendly relations; conciliation or rapprochement.
example: The two countries made a reconciliation after years of tension. / その二つの国の間には、多年の緊張を超えての和解が実現された。

definition_en: Of or pertaining to regulation.
example: The company must follow regulatory guidelines to ensure product safety. / その会社は製品安全を確保するためには、規制のガイドラインに従う必要がある。

definition_en: To cause a short circuit in (something).
meanings_ja:
Here are the Japanese translations for the English word "shorting":

短期的な売買: [Meaning 1: Temporary sale]
金融市場での売買: [Meaning 2: Trading in financial markets]

例文: The company was accused of shorting their own stock to manipulate the market. / その会社は、株式を売り上げて市場の操作を行ったと非難された。

Note: Shorting is a term commonly used in finance, particularly in the context of securities trading. It can refer to either temporary sales or trading in financial markets, depending on the context.
example: The company was accused of shorting their own stock to manipulate the market. / その会社は、株式を売り上げて市場の操作を行ったと非難された。

definition_en: A long, narrow ditch or hole dug in the ground.
example: The soldiers dug a trench to protect themselves from enemy fire. / 兵隊は敵の攻撃から自分達を守るために戦壕を作った。

definition_en: To not hold in sufficiently high esteem.
meanings_ja: 価値が低く評価されない
example: The artist was underappreciated during her lifetime, but is now widely recognized. / 彼女は生涯にわたり評価されなかったが、現在は広く認められている。
